Understate: The claim understates Will Hurd's actual stance on a border-long U.S.-Mexico wall, as he has expressed that it is not the most effective way to do border security.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that Will Hurd unequivocally supports a border-long U.S.-Mexico wall.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Will Hurd's statement of "A wall absolutely makes sense" refers to a border-long U.S.-Mexico wall, when in fact he was referring to heavily populated areas.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that Will Hurd's support for a wall is limited to heavily populated areas, rather than a border-long wall.
